Premier League Review: 2012/13
programme.desc: A review of the 2012/13 season. Sir Alex Ferguson ended his managerial career as Manchester United clinched their 13th Premier League title and FA Cup winners Wigan were relegated.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2013/14
programme.desc: A review of the 2013/14 season. Manchester City clinched their second Premier League title, Jose Mourinho returned to Chelsea and Tony Pulis masterminded a great escape at Palace.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2014/15
programme.desc: A review of the 2014/15 season. Eden Hazard's superb form helped Chelsea clinch their fifth title, while newly-promoted Burnley and QPR made immediate returns to the Championship.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2015/16
programme.desc: A review of the 2015/16 season. Leicester City shocked the footballing world, Jose Mourinho's second tenure at Chelsea came to an end and Newcastle dropped into the second tier.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2016/17
programme.desc: Take a look back at the 2016/17 Premier League season as Chelsea win their fifth Premier League title and reigning champions Leicester set a new record for worst title defence.

programme.title: Serie A: Genoa v Atalanta
programme.desc: Action from Serie A as Genoa and Atalanta go head-to-head at Stadio Luigi Ferraris. Atalanta beat Genoa 4-0 in the Coppa Italia earlier this month.

programme.title: The Monuments
programme.desc: Spanning Germany and Austria, the Four Hills tournament is the pinnacle of ski jumping.We dive into the drama, rivalries, and cultural aspects of this iconic event.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2017/18
programme.desc: A look back at the 2017/18 Premier League season as Manchester City win their third title, Mohamed Salah scores 32 goals for Liverpool and Stoke's top flight status ends.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2018/19
programme.desc: A look back at the 2018/19 Premier League season that was competitive until the very end, with fans captivated by an epic title race between Manchester City and Liverpool.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2019/20
programme.desc: A look back at the 2019/20 Premier League season as a pandemic-disrupted season saw Liverpool win their first ever Premier League title.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2020/21
programme.desc: A look back at the 2020/21 Premier League season as Manchester City regained the title and won their fifth Premier League title.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2021/22
programme.desc: A look back at all the highs and lows from an epic 2021/22 Premier League season, which saw a thrilling title race between Man City and Liverpool come down to the final day.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2022/23
programme.desc: A review the biggest stories and best action from 2022/23 Premier League season, as Pep Guardiola's Manchester City look to secure a third consecutive title.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2023/24
programme.desc: We revisit all the drama and best action from the 2023/24 Premier League season. Manchester City were looking to become the first side to win four EPL titles in a row.

programme.title: Premier League Review: 2024/25
programme.desc: A look back at all the twists and turns from the 2024/25 Premier League season, as Liverpool began life after Jurgen Klopp and Man City chased a fifth consecutive title.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: We sit down with the lesser-known graduates of Man United's iconic Class of '92 to gain a rare and revealing window into the reality behind the legend.

programme.title: Premier League Netbusters
programme.desc: A unique and fast-paced look at all the best action from the Premier League, including Newcastle v Chelsea, Spurs v Liverpool, and Aston Villa v Man United.

programme.title: Serie A - Full Impact
programme.desc: All the best moments from matchday 16 of Serie A, including Juventus v Roma, Lazio v Cremonese, and Genoa v Atalanta.

programme.title: Isuzu UTE A-League Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from round nine of the Isuzu UTE A-League, including Macarthur v Brisbane, Western Sydney v Auckland, and Newcastle Jets v Sydney FC.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2005
programme.desc: The 2004/05 UEFA Champions League final saw Rafa Benitez's Liverpool take on AC Milan in Istanbul. The match would go down as arguably the greatest European Cup final in history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2012
programme.desc: We revisit the 2011/12 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Chelsea at the Allianz Arena. This was Chelsea's second final, having lost their last in 2008.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2012
programme.desc: We revisit the 2011/12 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Chelsea at the Allianz Arena. This was Chelsea's second final, having lost their last in 2008.

programme.title: Match Officials Mic'd Up
programme.desc: Howard Webb reviews recent refereeing decisions from the Premier League, including Idrissa Gueye's red card and Georginio Rutter's equaliser against West Ham.

programme.title: The Big Interview: Michael Carrick
programme.desc: Former England and Manchester United midfielder Michael Carrick reflects on his success at Old Trafford, working under Sir Alex Ferguson, and what his future may hold.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: We sit down with the lesser-known graduates of Man United's iconic Class of '92 to gain a rare and revealing window into the reality behind the legend.

programme.title: Premier League Reload
programme.desc: A whirlwind catch-up from matchday 17 of the Premier League, including Newcastle v Chelsea, Spurs v Liverpool, Aston Villa v Man United, and more.

programme.title: UEFA Conference League Goals Reload
programme.desc: A look at the best goals from matchday six of the UEFA Conference League. Crystal Palace faces Finnish side KuPS, while AC Sparta Praha hosted Aberdeen.

programme.title: New Zealand v WI - 3rd Test Review
programme.desc: A review of the third Test between New Zealand and West Indies at Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui, where the hosts were looking to secure a series win.

programme.title: The Edge: The Ashes 3rd Test
programme.desc: Sir James Anderson and Sir Alastair Cook join Craig Doyle to reflect on the third Ashes Test from Adelaide, where England's faint hopes of regaining the urn were fully extinguished.

programme.desc: After Australia retained the urn in Adelaide, Ben Stokes' England side look to restore some pride in the Boxing Day Test at the MCG. Can the tourists get off to a strong start?

programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. programme.title: Voetbal Geeft
programme.desc: Rob (78) is al meer dan zeventig jaar supporter van Heracles Almelo. Onlangs kreeg hij de diagnose dementie. Juist omdat zijn geheugen hem nu steeds vaker in de steek laat, zijn de herinneringen aan het stadion voor Rob van onschatbare waarde. Daarom sprak hij één grote wens uit: nog één allerlaatste keer een wedstrijd van zijn club meemaken.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de eerste aflevering staat de hoekschop centraal. Wat is het geheim van een goede hoekschop en waarom veert het thuispubliek altijd op terwijl maar 4 procent van alle hoekschoppen een goal oplevert? Met hulp van o.a. analyticus Arnold Bruggink, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én cornerspecialist Nourdin Boukhari gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de tweede aflevering staat de keeper centraal. Zijn keepers echt een beetje gek? Met hulp van o.a. oud-keeper Henk Timmer, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én keeperspecialist Frans Hoek gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Go Ahead Eagles is bezig aan een nu al historisch seizoen. De club is regerend bekerwinnaar én reuzendoder in de Eredivisie en Europa League. De opmars van rood en geel is te zien in een gloednieuwe reeks van Home of Eus, de documentaireserie van Özcan Akyol (Eus). In de eerste aflevering onderzoekt Eus hoe Go Ahead Eagles zich klaarmaakt voor het grootste seizoen uit haar clubhistorie. En dat terwijl 'Kowet' nog maar zeven jaar geleden bivakkeerde in de kelder van de Eerste Divisie.

Juist omdat zijn geheugen hem nu steeds vaker in de steek laat, zijn de herinneringen aan het stadion voor Rob van onschatbare waarde. Daarom sprak hij één grote wens uit: nog één allerlaatste keer een wedstrijd van zijn club meemaken.

programme.title: Café Galgenwaard
programme.desc: In Cafe Galgenwaard van FC Utrecht TV schuiven eens per maand (oud-)spelers, bestuurders en clubvolgers aan om te bespreken wat er speelt rondom FC Utrecht. In deze speciale kerstaflevering zijn trainer Ron Jans en zijn assistenten Kevin van Veen en Rob Penders te gast.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek 'Warmlopers' krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.desc: In de jaren '80 maakt O.J. naam als acteur en trouwt hij met Nicole Brown. Het leven in LA lijkt hem toe te lachen, maar het is ook de periode dat de eerste verhalen over huiselijk geweld de kop op steken.

programme.title: ESPN Film
programme.desc: Bij het appartement van Simpson komen twee mensen om het leven, onder wie zijn inmiddels ex-vrouw. O.J. komt steeds verder in het nauw en slaat op de vlucht.

programme.title: ESPN Film

programme.desc: Mario Been blies onlangs zestig kaarsjes uit. Om dat te vieren besloten zijn vrienden om hem mee terug te nemen naar het Italiaanse Pisa, waar Been drie jaar speelde voor de plaatselijke club. programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de eerste aflevering staat de hoekschop centraal. Wat is het geheim van een goede hoekschop en waarom veert het thuispubliek altijd op terwijl maar 4 procent van alle hoekschoppen een goal oplevert? Met hulp van o.a. analyticus Arnold Bruggink, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én cornerspecialist Nourdin Boukhari gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek 'Warmlopers' krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek 'Warmlopers' krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

programme.title: Dossier Eredivisie
programme.desc: In Dossier Eredivisie komen de mooiste momenten van de rijke historie van de leukste competitie ter wereld voorbij. In de eerste aflevering staat de hoekschop centraal. Wat is het geheim van een goede hoekschop en waarom veert het thuispubliek altijd op terwijl maar 4 procent van alle hoekschoppen een goal oplevert? Met hulp van o.a. analyticus Arnold Bruggink, Eredivisie-veteranen Bryan Linssen en Jens Toornstra én cornerspecialist Nourdin Boukhari gaat Wouter op zoek naar antwoorden.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Mario Been blies onlangs zestig kaarsjes uit. Om dat te vieren besloten zijn vrienden om hem mee terug te nemen naar het Italiaanse Pisa, waar Been drie jaar speelde voor de plaatselijke club. In 'Grande Mario' reizen we met drie voetbalvrienden terug in de tijd, naar de gloriejaren van de Serie A.

programme.title: ESPN DOC
programme.desc: Op 25 november 2025 is het precies vijf jaar geleden dat Diego Armando Maradona overleed. De Argentijn loodste zijn land in 1986 eigenhandig naar de wereldtitel en nam eind jaren '80 het toen nog kleine Napoli bij de hand op weg naar twee Italiaanse landstitels. In 'Op zoek naar Maradona' ontmoet AD-journalist Sjoerd Mossou - schrijver van het gelijknamige boek - verschillende mensen op wie Maradona grote indruk maakte.

programme.title: Voetbal Geeft
programme.desc: Rob (78) is al meer dan zeventig jaar supporter van Heracles Almelo. Onlangs kreeg hij de diagnose dementie. Juist omdat zijn geheugen hem nu steeds vaker in de steek laat, zijn de herinneringen aan het stadion voor Rob van onschatbare waarde. Daarom sprak hij één grote wens uit: nog één allerlaatste keer een wedstrijd van zijn club meemaken.

programme.title: Voetbalpraatjes
programme.desc: Presentatrice Fresia Cousiño Arias ontvangt drie jonge voetbalvolgers in de setting van Voetbalpraat. Geen tactische analyses of ingewikkelde statistieken, maar voetbal zoals kinderen het beleven: spontaan, vrolijk en enthousiast. Voetbalpraatjes neemt de kijker mee in de voetbalbeleving van kinderen, die onder anderen reageren op stellingen van bekende spelers en speelsters. En in de rubriek 'Warmlopers' krijgen kinderen een exclusief kijkje achter de schermen.

DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The fourth day of the DP World Tour's Bahrain Championship, taking place at the Royal Golf Club. In winning last year's event, Dylan Frittelli ended a six-year wait for success. (02.02)

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the DP World Tour's Joburg Open, taking place at Houghton Golf Club in South Africa.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the DP World Tour's 2025 Porsche Singapore Classic, showcasing some of Asia's brightest stars at Laguna National Golf Resort Club.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the Hainan Classic, a new DP World Tour event for 2025 held at Mission Hills Resort Haikou in China.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 KLM Open, a DP World Tour event held at the International in Amsterdam.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from 2025 BMW International Open, a DP World Tour event Golfclub München Eichenried in Germany. Scotland's Ewen Ferguson claimed victory last season.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the DP World Tour's Nexo Championship - formerly the Scottish Championship - taking place at Trump International Golf Links in Aberdeen, Scotland.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Danish Golf Championship, a DP World Tour event taking place at Furesø Golf Klub in Copenhagen. Frenchman Frederic Lacroix returns to defend the title.

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf Hlts
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 Women's Scottish Open, a Ladies European Tour event held at Dundonald Links on the Ayrshire coast. This year's field boasts 13 Major champions.

programme.title: Chronicles of a Champion Golfer...
programme.desc: A look at a champion golfer at the world's pre-eminent Major, The Open. Here, look at the achievements of Scotsman Sandy Lyle, who was victorious at Royal St George's in 1985.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: Day four of the DP World Tour Championship at the Jumeirah Golf Estates in Dubai. Andy Sullivan led by a shot overnight from Rory McIlroy, who is chasing a second title here.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: Day four at the Irish Open Hosted By The Rory Foundation. After Saturday saw play suspended, Rory McIlroy goes into today leading on nine under, three clear of Masters champ Danny Willett.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: Highlights from the 2022 Tour Championship, as the FedExCup champion is crowned from between the PGA Tour's top 30 players at East Lake Golf Club in Georgia.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: The fifth and final day of the 2023 Dubai Desert Classic at the Emirates Golf Club. Rory McIlroy holds a three-shot lead, with rival Patrick Reed among the chasers. (30.01)

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2023 Genesis Scottish Open, taking place at the Renaissance Club. Among a star-studded field, Xander Schauffele is this year's defending champion. (16.07)

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2024 Wells Fargo Championship, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Wyndham Clark scooped the $3,600,000 prize pot last year.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: The fourth and final round of the DP World Tour Championship - the final event of the 2024 season - held on Jumeirah Golf Estates' Earth Course in Dubai. (17.11)

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am, a PGA Tour event held in California. Wyndham Clark earned his third tour win here a year ago.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: The official film of the 2025 Players Championship at TPC Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach. It would take a play-off between JJ Spaun and Rory McIlroy to decide the fate of the 51st edition.

programme.title: Best of Rory McIlroy
programme.desc: The fourth and final round of the 2025 Amgen Irish Open, a DP World Tour event staged at the K Club in Straffan, County Kildare. (07.09)

programme.title: Masters Final Round
programme.desc: On Sunday at Augusta, Rory McIlroy takes the 54-hole lead into the final round of The Masters as Bryson DeChambeau bids to deny the Irishman a first Green Jacket and the career Grand Slam.

programme.title: McIlroy '25: A Career Year
programme.desc: A look at an unprecedented year in the career of the newly minted Grand Slam champion Rory McIlroy, who finally ended his wait for an illustrious Green Jacket during the 2025 season.

programme.title: Masters Official Film 2025
programme.desc: The official film of the unforgettable 2025 Masters, where Rory McIlroy ended his agonising wait for the career Grand Slam in a dramatic play-off with Ryder Cup teammate Justin Rose.

programme.title: U.S. Open Golf Official Film 2011
programme.desc: A chance to relive the 2011 US Open which was held at Congressional Country Club in Maryland. Northern Ireland's Rory McIlroy stormed to the first Major title of his career.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2012
programme.desc: The official film of the 2012 PGA Championship from Kiawah Island Golf Resort in South Carolina. Keegan Bradley entered this tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: The Open Films: McIlroy 2014
programme.desc: A look back at some of the best contests at The Open in years gone by. This episode focuses on the 2014 tournament, held at the Royal Liverpool Golf Club.

programme.title: PGA Championship Official Film2014
programme.desc: The official film of the 2014 PGA Championship from Valhalla Golf Club in Kentucky. Jason Dufner entered this tournament as defending champion.

programme.title: Masters Final Round Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the final round of The Masters. Rory McIlroy held the lead heading into a Sunday duel with Bryson DeChambeau, each trying to add a Masters to his Major portfolio. (13.04)

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The fourth and final day of the 2025 Chevron Championship - the first women's Major of the 2025 season. Haeran Ryu and Mao Saigo are the frontrunners heading into Sunday at Carlton Woods.

programme.title: Ryder Cup Day 1 Foursomes
programme.desc: At Bethpage Black in New York, the 45th Ryder Cup begins with foursomes. Team Europe are the reigning champions, but haven't won on American soil since the Miracle of Medinah in 2012.

programme.title: Ryder Cup Day 1 Fourballs
programme.desc: Friday's fourballs get underway on the opening day of the 45th Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black. It's advantage Europe after the morning foursomes as Luke Donald's men lead the Americans 3-1.

programme.title: My Ryder Cup: Justin Rose
programme.desc: Playing five of six Ryder Cups from 2008 through to 2018 - and another in 2023 - Justin Rose recalls his memories of the event.

programme.title: Ryder Cup 2023: Una Famiglia
programme.desc: Join Luke Donald a year on from Team Europe's 2023 Ryder Cup win, as the Englishman details his journey to the captaincy and the spirit he cultivated in the team. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: WTA Finals 2025 Riyadh Review
programme.desc: A review of the 2025 WTA Finals, the season-ending event held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: With the weight of Wimbledon final defeat lifted, Amanda Anisimova enters a last-four clash with the two-time US Open champion Naomi Osaka - her first Grand Slam semi since 2021.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: During his eighth appearance at Flushing Meadows, former British men's number one Cam Norrie's US Open campaign continued against 24-year-old Argentinian Francisco Comesana.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: In the fourth round of the women's singles at the 2025 US Open, Taylor Townsend's dream New York run saw the American take on two-time Grand Slam champion Barbora Krejcikova.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: American Tommy Paul, the 14th seed at Flushing Meadows, entered a third-round contest at the 2025 US Open against an in-form Alexander Bublik on Arthur Ashe.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Crowned Australian Open champion earlier in the year, sixth seed Madison Keys began her 2025 US Open bid on Arthur Ashe Stadium against Mexican Renata Zarazúa.

programme.title: Best of the US Open 2025
programme.desc: Coco Gauff gets underway in New York as the 2023 women's singles champion plays former quarter-finalist Ajla Tomljanovic of Australia. The pair last met in the Paris Olympics.

programme.title: United Cup Final 2025
programme.desc: The two top seeds at the United Cup - the United States and Poland - meet in Sydney in the final with Iga Swiatek up against Coco Gauff, while Taylor Fritz takes on Hubert Hurkacz. (05.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Brisbane
programme.desc: World number one Aryna Sabalenka looks to claim a second Brisbane International title, after success in 2023, against qualifier Polina Kudermetova. (05.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hong Kong
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of ATP Hong Kong.

programme.title: WTA Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Hobart
programme.desc: A two-time winner of the Hobart International, Elise Mertens returns to the final for a fourth time as the Belgian number two seed takes on the unseeded American McCartney Kessler. (11.01)

programme.title: United Cup Final 2025
programme.desc: The two top seeds at the United Cup - the United States and Poland - meet in Sydney in the final with Iga Swiatek up against Coco Gauff, while Taylor Fritz takes on Hubert Hurkacz. (05.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Brisbane
programme.desc: World number one Aryna Sabalenka looks to claim a second Brisbane International title, after success in 2023, against qualifier Polina Kudermetova. (05.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Hong Kong
programme.desc: A men's singles champion is crowned in the final of ATP Hong Kong.

programme.title: WTA Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: In an all-American final at the Adelaide International, Jessica Pegula and Madison Keys contest the third instalment of their rivalry, with the head-to-head record at one apiece. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Adelaide
programme.desc: Number two seed Sebastian Korda of America stands between Felix Auger-Aliassime and a sixth tour-level title for the Canadian, as the two clash in the Adelaide International final. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP Final: Auckland
programme.desc: Gael Monfils becomes the second-oldest player to reach an ATP Tour final since 1990, as the 38-year-old Frenchman meets Belgian qualifier Zizou Bergs in Auckland at the ASB Classic. (11.01)

programme.title: WTA Final: Hobart
programme.desc: A two-time winner of the Hobart International, Elise Mertens returns to the final for a fourth time as the Belgian number two seed takes on the unseeded American McCartney Kessler. (11.01)

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In their first ever match in what would become a trophy-laden rivalry, Roger Federer - the then world number one - encountered Rafael Nadal in the third round of the 2004 Miami Open.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In the match that resulted in Serena Williams' 14-year boycott of Indian Wells, the then 19-year-old fought Kim Clijsters in front of a volatile crowd - ultimately clinching her second titl

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a five-hour, five-set Rome Open epic, an 18-year-old Rafael Nadal lit up the Foro Italico in his back-and-forth contest with Argentina's Guillermo Coria.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In pursuit of the first of her three Toronto titles, Serena Williams came across serial winner Monica Seles, a four-time winner in her own right, in the 2001 semi-finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: The budding Rafael Nadal-Roger Federer rivalry comes to a boil as the iconic pair went head to head in the 2006 Rome Masters final. Nadal had won four of their first five meetings.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Roaring back from long-term injury, former champion Kim Clijsters would meet top seed and world number one Lindsay Davenport in the 2005 Indian Wells final.

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: Off to a winning WTA Finals start, the year-end world number one Aryna Sabalenka faces Jessica Pegula in a 2024 US Open final rematch. Pegula also got underway in Riyadh with a win. (04.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: It's all on the line in a winner-takes-all trilogy match for Iga Swiatek and Amanda Anisimova at the WTA Finals in Riyadh, with the winner advancing to the semi-finals. (05.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: Unbeaten in Riyadh so far, Elena Rybakina attempts to extend her winning run at the WTA Finals against Jessica Pegula, who's seeking her second championship appearance at the event. (07.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: In a repeat of the 2025 US Open final, Aryna Sabalenka and Amanda Anisimova go toe to toe for a spot in Saturday's final at the year-end event in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. (07.11)

programme.title: Best Of The WTA Finals
programme.desc: Aryna Sabalenka and Elena Rybakina - both undefeated in Riyadh - bid to become a first-time WTA Finals champion. This is the 14th meeting between the two, with Sabalenka 8-5 ahead. (08.11)

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz and last year's runner-up Taylor Fritz, both looking to improve to 2-0, meet in Turin. Alcaraz is two wins away from becoming the year-end world number one. (11.11)

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Home hope Lorenzo Musetti enters a high-stakes match-up with seventh seed Alex de Minaur in Turin. After opening-game defeats, the two are looking to avoid an unwanted 0-2 start. (11.11)

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Still yet to drop a set at the ATP Finals in Turin, world number two Jannik Sinner faces Alex de Minaur in the semi-finals. The Italian has won all 12 meetings between the pair. (15.11)

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz, having secured the world number one ranking for the year-end, enters the semi-finals at the ATP Finals in Turin, facing off against Felix Auger-Aliassime. (15.11)

programme.title: Best Of The ATP Finals
programme.desc: World number one Carlos Alcaraz faces Italy's reigning ATP Finals champion Jannik Sinner in their sixth meeting of the year, marking the finale to the 2025 Tour season in Turin. (16.11)

programme.title: ATP Beijing 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the 2025 China Open, an ATP Tour 500 event held in Beijing.

programme.title: ATP Tokyo 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the 2025 Japan Open, an ATP Tour 500 event staged in Tokyo.

programme.title: ATP Paris 2025 Review
programme.desc: A review of the ATP Tour's final Masters 1000 event of 2025 in the capital of France.

programme.title: Sampras v Agassi 2002
programme.desc: In the men's singles final at the 2002 US Open, Pete Sampras would embark on the final match of his illustrious career, extending his perfect record over Andre Agassi at the New York Slam.

programme.title: Alcaraz v Sinner 2022
programme.desc: Return to a classic tennis match for the ages, as Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner locked horns for a blistering five hours and 15 minutes in the 2022 US Open quarter-finals.

programme.title: Alcaraz v Ruud 2022
programme.desc: Carlos Alcaraz and Casper Ruud went toe to toe in the final of the men's singles at the 2022 US Open. With the Arthur Ashe stage set, both players were going for a first career Grand Slam.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a five-hour, five-set Rome Open epic, an 18-year-old Rafael Nadal lit up the Foro Italico in his back-and-forth contest with Argentina's Guillermo Coria.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In pursuit of the first of her three Toronto titles, Serena Williams came across serial winner Monica Seles, a four-time winner in her own right, in the 2001 semi-finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: The budding Rafael Nadal-Roger Federer rivalry comes to a boil as the iconic pair went head to head in the 2006 Rome Masters final. Nadal had won four of their first five meetings.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Roaring back from long-term injury, former champion Kim Clijsters would meet top seed and world number one Lindsay Davenport in the 2005 Indian Wells final.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Andy Murray, the defending champion, and Novak Djokovic - meeting for the first time since the 2012 US Open final - went back and forth across three thrilling sets for the Shanghai title.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Clinching the fifth of her eight Miami Open titles, Serena Williams would have to overcome one of her great rivals Justine Henin as the pair met in a highly anticipated 2007 final.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Saving four match points in the process, Roger Federer was pushed to the limit in his 2014 ATP Finals semi-final meeting with fellow Swiss superstar Stan Wawrinka.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a three-hour test of wills, Justine Henin was bidding to close an up-and-down year with the defence of her WTA Finals title against Maria Sharapova in 2007.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a match that would decide the 2016 year-end world number one, Andy Murray - looking to cap a storybook season at The O2 in London - met rival Novak Djokovic at the ATP Finals.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Adding the Doha title to her successful Australian Open defence, Victoria Azarenka kept Serena Williams at bay as the top two seeds served up a memorable final in 2013.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: A 36-year-old Novak Djokovic rolled back the years in a three-set classic against world number one Carlos Alcaraz to claim the Cincinnati title - his 39th ATP Masters 1000 crown.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: A US Open finalist one month prior, Caroline Wozniacki's 2014 WTA Finals campaign got underway against then world number two Maria Sharapova in Singapore.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: The China Open climax sees Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz get set for a second final meeting. Sinner aims to defend the crown, while Alcaraz looks to avenge last year's defeat.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a rematch of the 2023 Madrid Open final, world number one Iga Swiatek and defending champion Aryna Sabalenka meet again to determine this year's women's singles champion.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras met in the 2001 Indian Wells final - one of 34 career meetings. Agassi eyed a second consecutive win over Sampras in their first meeting in over a year.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In the 1996 Indian Wells final, Steffi Graf - having made her competitive return after a four-month injury layoff - would compete with Spain's Conchita Martinez for the title.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: In a battle of generations, two of the all-time greats Roger Federer and Andre Agassi fought for the year-end championship in 2003. Federer was aiming for his first title on American soil.

programme.title: ATP/WTA Tour Classic Matches
programme.desc: Meeting for the first time in a final at tour level, the Williams sisters Venus and Serena went toe to toe in an emotionally charged contest for the Miami Open title.

programme.title: My Ryder Cup: Bernard Gallacher
programme.desc: Having competed in eight separate Ryder Cups, as well as becoming the non-playing captain of the European team in 1991, 1993 and 1995, Bernard Gallacher recalls his memories of the event.

programme.title: My Ryder Cup: Costantino Rocca
programme.desc: The first Italian to play for Europe in the Ryder Cup, Costantino Rocca recalls his memories of the event.

programme.title: DP World Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: The final day of the season-ending DP World Tour Championship, taking place Jumeirah Golf Estates in Dubai. (16.11)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the St Jude Championship - the first of three events to determine this year's FedExCup champion - as the top 70 in the standings compete in the FedExCup Playoffs.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the 2025 BMW Championship at Caves Valley Golf Club in Maryland. Here, the top 50 in the FedExCup standings compete to advance to the Tour Championship.

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Highlights
programme.desc: Tournament highlights from the season-ending Tour Championship as the top 30 compete at the FedExCup Playoffs finale in Atlanta, Georgia.

programme.title: Evian Championship Highlights
programme.desc: The final round of the Amundi Evian Championship, Europe's only women's Major, in Evian-les-Bains, France. Japanese golfer Ayaka Furue celebrated her first Major victory last year. (13.07)

programme.title: Ladies European Tour Golf
programme.desc: The final round of the Women's Scottish Open, held at Dundonald Links. The 36-hole-leader Lottie Woad of England is bidding to win a first LPGA Tour title on her professional debut.

programme.title: Ryder Cup Day 2 Foursomes
programme.desc: On day two of the 45th Ryder Cup at Bethpage Black in New York, foursomes resume. Friday belonged to Luke Donald's Team Europe, building a 5.5-2.5 advantage over the United States.

programme.title: Ryder Cup Day 2 Fourballs
programme.desc: The second day of Ryder Cup action continues with more fourballs at Bethpage Black in New York. Luke Donald's Team Europe hold a commanding 8.5-3.5 lead over Keegan Bradley's United States.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The final day of the CME Group Tour Championship at the Ritz Carlton Golf Resort. Jeeno Thitikul collected a generous $4 million winner's prize last season.
